children.value: The Dodock framework automatically creates new REST API endpoints for every DocType you create in the system.
You can also access you python methods through their dotted path by whitelisting them.
You can either authenticate yourself through the password base authentication method or through the token based authentication method.
Password based authentication relies on cookies and session data to maintain authentication in subsequent requests.
In most cases, the library you are using to issue REST calls will handle session data, but if it doesn't you should use Token based authentication.

props.className: language-js shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme material-theme-palenight

children.value: A token is a pair of API Key and API Secret.
First, you must create an API User and then generate the keys in the API Access section in the User form.
The token is generated by concatenating
to the Authorization header in the request.

props.className: language-js shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme material-theme-palenight

By default, it will return 20 records and will only fetch the name of the records.

Make sure you set the following headers in your requests so that you get proper JSON responses.

children.value: Dodock allows you to trigger arbitrary python methods using the REST API for handling custom logic. These methods must be marked as whitelisted to make them accessible via REST.
To run a whitelisted python method at
, send a request to the endpoint

props.className: language-bash shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme material-theme-palenight
language-json shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme material-theme-palenight

children.value: If your method returns some values, you should send a
If your method changes the state of the database, use
request, the framework will automatically call
to commit the changes to the database.
A successful response will return a JSON object with a message key.
An errored response will return a JSON object with
key which contains the stack trace and
The return value of the method will be converted to a JSON and sent as the response.
that accepts binary file data and uploads it into the system.
Here is the curl command for it:

props.code:
curl -X POST \
  http://<base-url>/api/method/upload_file \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Authorization: token xxxx:yyyy' \
  -F file=@/path/to/file/file.png
props.className: language-bash shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme material-theme-palenight

children.value: If you are using client side Javascript to upload files, you can append the uploaded files as FormData and send an XHR request.
